attributes.action: Establish a publicly owned and possibly funded film production company.
attributes.background: For 70 years The British film industry has been dominated by the American industry there are two known reason for this fact. The first being that the Americans have the advantage on distribution side  and the second being that they know they’ll receive British funding through tax relief breaks.
attributes.additional_details:
the solution is to establish a national production company which would by run by elective committee of British film makers with the purpose of producing Public service feature length films.

references

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-34013145

http://www.theguardian.com/film/2015/feb/03/record-revenues-for-films-made-in-uk 

http://www.theguardian.com/film/video/2010/aug/28/uk-film-council-arts-funding?INTCMP=SRCH

http://screenrant.com/british-film-industry-hollywood/

attributes.action: Back date money owed by HMRC to families with disabled children
attributes.background: HMRC has announced that it will only pay back money owed to families with disabled children for 2016/17. This is wrong. Families living day to day with the challenges of supporting a disabled child are themselves vulnerable. HMRC must repay all DLA tax credits owed to these families without delay.

attributes.action: Resurface the A11 between Attleborough Wymondham
attributes.background: The government are talking about spending 3 plus billion pounds on improving congested roads, not a bad thing. But we have a stretch of road between that the surface is diabolic it is dangerous for all road uses, it desperately needs doing before some gets killed.
attributes.additional_details: Most of the section is made from concrete, when cracks, pot holes etc. Appear they are being patch with tarmac, as soon as the weather is bad these repair break down and the holes reappear.

attributes.action: Restrict noise of fireworks at organised displays to a maximum of 120 decibels
attributes.background: Fireworks sold to members of the public are subject to a restriction of 120 decibels. I ask that all fireworks are subject to this restriction as those used at displays are becoming rediculously load causing terror and suffering to animals and young children

attributes.action: Exempt all properties with a broadband speed <10 Mbps from Council Tax
attributes.background: Broadband is an essential service, but due to local and central government decisions, many millions of people do not have sufficient access.  A lack of good broadband makes property unsaleable, i.e. essentially worthless, and so should not be subject to Council Tax.
attributes.additional_details: Various government initiatives have failed to provide the necessary service to all, indeed they have been specifically excluded from the programmes.  The option to move is not available with low speeds, and this disadvantage should be recompensed through exemption from Council Tax.  The USO is still some years away, by which time further improvements in speed will be required,  Therefore, the 10Mbps rate should double every 2 years in line with Nielsen's Law of Internet Bandwidth.

attributes.action: Immediate ban on unregulated Private Parking companies from accessing DVLA data.
attributes.background:
Citizens Advice recently reported a dramatic rise in people seeking help about penalties for parking on private land – trebling from 16,300 to 50,000.
They should be forced to install parking barriers not Aprn cameras.
attributes.additional_details:
The injustice of heavy fines for small parking errors.
Victim’s mental wellbeing is never a concern.
They've mastered to make life difficult for drivers.
A group of private car parking companies threatened to take moneysaving expert to court an attempt to stop them from telling consumers their legitimate rights.
According to the DVLA, private parking operators have requested  details of drivers more than three million times in the last year, which has increased from 2.4 million the year before.

attributes.action: Reform the Misuse of Drugs Act
attributes.background:
We call upon the government to recognise that the “War on Drugs” has been a complete failure and that people will always take drugs regardless of the law.

We believe that all currently illegal drugs must be decriminalised with certain recreational drugs such as Cannabis being legalised completely
attributes.additional_details:
By continuing with our current war on drugs, we are facilitating criminal enterprises and causing the death of thousands of users through fake, dangerously cut drugs or synthetic replacements (So called Legal High’s).

We also need a new approach especially with the legalisation of Marijuana in certain US states and potentially the whole of Canada (in 2017). 

The world is changing. The criminals are happy with the current law, but we feel that it’s time to reform our 1970’s approach to drugs.

attributes.action: Make diagnosed medical need the same as disability for discrimination laws
attributes.background: As someone suffering from diagnosed coeliac disease, I am appalled that there is no legislation which protects our rights (and those with other medically diagnosed conditions) from discrimination, unless that diagnosis happens to be recognised as a disability in law.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst restaurants, cafes and other public bodies and places have to make reasonable adjustments for people with disability, there is no requirement for them to do likewise for a medically diagnosed condition, such as diabetes and coeliac disease.

Hospitals often fail to provide any gluten free menu options for coeliacs and despite NICE guidelines, the NHS trusts are withdrawing prescriptions for gluten free food, the only treatment for coeliacs (yet still prescribe food for other conditions).

attributes.action: increase penalties for leaving the scene of an accident in a motor vehicle
attributes.background: I wish to increase the penalties emposed to drivers if found leaving the scene of an accident. I feel dissapointed that police do not enforce sufficient penalties for people who leave someone or something for dead at sides of roads after hitting them. same applies to accidents with vehicles
attributes.additional_details: Spring hill road - accrington - DOG Killed by speeding driver who made off, leaving owner at side of road in a state with no way of knowing who killed her dog. police was informed and she was told without a number plate we cant help.

attributes.action: bikers with a CBT dont have to ride with L plates after 2 years on the road
attributes.background: riding with L plates and riding without any L plates make no difference on a bike all they do is keep breaking off and left laying on the road making it a hazard
attributes.additional_details:
L plate left laying on the road is a hazard , it is a danger to other bikers it could pop a Tyre and cause serious body damage or even death 

it also can be just as dangerous to car drivers or buses/lorry's as if they cant control a blow out they could end up going in to a head on crash or in to a pedestrian walking on the pavement 

can also be a danger if a vehicle drives over  a L plate it could be brought up in the air and his a vehicle following behind

attributes.action: Build new and expand, grammar schools in England to provide quality education.
attributes.background: Recently Warwickshire council eleven plus exam was held. There were a couple of thousands of pupils who sat for the exam. But there are only about 300 to 400 places in the grammar schools in Warwickshire.  Please allow more and do not ban outright on the grounds of social mobility.
attributes.additional_details: The parents who want their child to study in grammar schools need to go through lot of struggles now.  House prices in grammar school catchment area is very high. As the population grows, demand for grammar schools among low and middle class families increased many folds. Allowing more grammar schools would only provide more choices to the parents and help social mobility. A blanket ban would cause more pressure to many hard working parents who wants to provide quality education.

attributes.action: Vets to be regulated by a independent governing body impartially from the RCVS
attributes.background:
Vets are not regulated by any real governing body at present, and can charge as much as they like, and go back on their word. 
They can give the wrong advise to a owner which can be costly and put a animal through unnecessary treatments.
It needs to be regulated like all other services.
attributes.additional_details:
A vet can offer a service but then change their mind at a later date, for example offering to put a animal to sleep for free as they animal had surgery on their advice which made the situation worse and the animal to suffer more, and then charge the owner at a later date. 
Vets also prey on owners whose animal is sick and put profit ahead of the animals well being, and the RCVS can do little to help.
They are not answerable to anything and this needs to change.

attributes.action: To have a 'No Bullying' Campaign/Policy in all educational sites across the UK.
attributes.background: During my time at school I had my fair share of bullying and was made to feel out of place. Speaking with local parents, who think schools don't do enough to prevent bullying, would like the government to set strict guidelines that must be followed in education for bullying, not set by the schools.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/bullying-at-school/the-law - says that policies are set by the school. If it was set by the government then all schools would be the same regarding the 'Behaviour Policy'. Schools could also teach that everyone is different have it be sexual orientation or religion, race which could prevent bullying. I will be campaigning to STOP THE BULLYING!! 

Questionnaire below:
https://www.surveymonkey.co.uk/r/LZNSF7K
Will be sent to schools and colleges around the UK for research.

attributes.action: Keep the production, sale and use of cannabis illegal.
attributes.background: Cannabis is a harmful drug. It's not a recreational substance that should be classed as "legal" as doing this will only make it more accessible to vulnerable young people and consequently cause more damage to our society.

attributes.action: Introduce a job test for all prospective MPs.
attributes.background: It is necessary to complete a test for most jobs, yet currently there is no testing of candidates for membership of parliament. There is a suspicion amongst many of the public that some MPs are "out of touch" or "not fit for purpose". A test would improve public confidence.
attributes.additional_details: As an initial idea for discussion, I propose 100 questions around 10 subjects including history, maths, logic/IQ, economics, general knowledge, culture, the world, and so on. Like most tests, this test would be changed frequently, marking would be anonymous, and scores would not be published. A candidate would only know they had passed or failed, with a pass mark being perhaps 80%. A candidate would be entitled to a second attempt, but only after the current election had ended.

attributes.action: Have a minimum age of 12 years old before having a body piercing.
attributes.background: Babies and toddlers often have their ears pierced because their parents think it will look nice. It causes the child pain and puts them at risk of infection. It should be left to the individual as to whether they wish to have holes made through their own skin when they are old enough to understand.

attributes.action: Change the NHS 24 week revival rule
attributes.background: At the moment doctors are under no legal obligation to help any babies born before 24 weeks gestation, from what doctors have told me this is because they say babies don't have developed lungs until 24 weeks. However the earliest baby to survive was born at just 21 weeks.
attributes.additional_details: 3 years ago my son was born at just 20 weeks, he was born alive and fought for his life for 2 hours before taking his last breath. Doctors did nothing to help my baby because of the 24 week rule, and I'm sure there are hundreds of families in my situation. Like I said the earliest baby to survive was born at 21 weeks, the only reason the hospital helped her is because she lied about how far gone she was. The bottom line of a hospitals job is to keep people alive when they enter the hospital.

attributes.action: Immediate management of Seagull numbers in South West England.
attributes.background: I live with my family in a seaside town called Budleigh Salterton, Devon and was recently attacked by a seagull while out with my newborn son who was in his pram at the time. The seagulls steal food, scare tourists, create mess and damage cars

attributes.action: Pensioners should get the same amount of money as immigrants not 6000 pa
attributes.background: Pensioners only get 150 a week to live on barely enough for food let alone clothes heating and immigrants get thousands we should be looking after are old not helping them to suffer
attributes.additional_details: Pensioners 6000 per year immigrants 26000 sometimes more

attributes.action: BRING BACK DEATH PENALTY FOR TERROISM AND TREASON
attributes.background:
bring back the death penalty for terroism acts against the united kingdom 
also bring back the death penalty on anyone who commits treason this should be anyone who tries to burn the flag tries to turn people against the united kingdom and  cause hatred

attributes.action: To prevent women from serving in frontline infantry units
attributes.background: In order to prevent a drop in morale among male ranks currently serving in frontline units.

attributes.action: Guarantee that EU nationals legally settled here before the Referendum can stay.
attributes.background: We should honour our responsibility to treat fairly our friends and colleagues from other EU countries, who were legally settled in the UK before the June 23rd Referendum.

attributes.action: Prior to any referendum a government inquiry be held on consequences either way.
attributes.background: Subsequent to the EU referendum committee hearings have been held revealing consequences, effects and subsequent necessary actions and criticism has been made of the claims made by campaigners, such information is useful to lawmakers and to voters. Rules for such campaigns/ campaigners are required.

attributes.action: Make rail companies social enterprises instead of profit-making parasites
attributes.background: The shambolic performance of Southern rail shows that the system is broken. People are in fear of losing their jobs because they cannot reliably get a train to work. Parents spend little time with their children because of delayed journeys home. Who and what are the rail companies for?

attributes.action: Give voters more powers to unseat an MP who is not representing their interests
attributes.background: In the EU referendum, many constituents felt let down by their local MP, after showing support for the opposing view. In some instances it was abundantly clear the MP was completely at odds with their constituency, e.g. Kate Hoey. In such cases, we should be able to request a vote to unseat the MP.
attributes.additional_details: The Borough of Lambeth voted overwhelmingly in favour of remaining in the EU, with 79%, the highest in the England. The MP for Vauxhall Kate Hoey, campaigned for the UK to leave, which demonstrates that she no longer represents the interests of the majority of her constituents. This poses the question of whether she should remain in her seat or give her constituents the power to vote for a new MP.

attributes.action: Ban the use of "committed suicide" by public bodies or in any official context.
attributes.background: My Grandfather ended his own life 11 years ago, for reasons we will never know. My Grandmother never recovered from both finding him after he had passed, but more so the stigma attached to the way in which he died. Suicide isn't a crime, and the term 'committed' should cease to be used in reference.
attributes.additional_details: There was a similar petition to this which recently gained over 2000 signatures, but this has since become inactive due to it being on here for more than six months and failing to obtain 10,000 signatures. I am doing several charity events to raise money for the SOBS charity who help those left behind following death by suicide, and I would like to reignite this petition, gaining enough signatures for this issue to be seen and considered in parliament.

attributes.action: Make all 'Brexit' discussions open to public scrutiny.
attributes.background:
Transparency within the European Union has been a real concern since its conception, it was also a significant argument in the Brexit 'debate'.

In a democracy the elected are accountable to the electorate and accountability demands transparency.
attributes.additional_details:
The British people have made the decision to leave the EU and they have the right to hear all the negotiations conducted in their name.

We call on David Cameron and all other UK representatives not to enter any negotiations unless they are fully minuted and broadcast live via radio or television.

Furthermore, we call upon our government officials to insist any 'Brexit' negotiations held by our EU partners which exclude UK representatives be fully minuted and broadcast live.

attributes.action: Citizens must pass GCSE level maths and English to vote
attributes.background: Citizens under the age of 18 are unable to vote due to not being mature enough to understand implications of elections and referendums. However, maturity should not be determined by age.
attributes.additional_details:
Passing basic mathematical and English competency tests will ensure voters are able to better make informed choices, and understand the implications and consequences of their voting choice. 

Very often voters are misinformed, and unable to distinguish fact from fiction due to their lack of education. It should therefore go without saying that not being able to understand basic maths and English should also correlate with poor understanding of elections and referendums.

attributes.action: Hold 2nd EU referendum, allowing 16 & 17 year olds in Scotland to vote.
attributes.background: The Scottish referendum and EU referendum are linked. 16 & 17 yr olds were allowed to vote in the Scottish referendum. Scotland's position as part of the UK is now uncertain based on the Brexit result. Today's 16 & 17 year olds should be given the same rights to defend their future as in 2014.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-36616028

2nd Scottish independence referendum likely: http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/24/alex-salmond-second-scottish-independence-referendum-is-certain

http://indy100.independent.co.uk/article/how-old-people-have-screwed-over-the-younger-generationin-three-charts--W1AA_n4nEb

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/06/26/scottish-independence-has-nearly-60-per-cent-support-poll-finds/

attributes.action: Formal identification required to sign petitions for Parliament to consider.
attributes.background: The Petitions sign on procedure to be changed to that like 'passenger information checks' on aircraft, in so far as formal identification be required for the petition to be accepted. UK Passport, or similar identification that proves the signatory is eligible, and to prevent fraud.
attributes.additional_details:
We have seen petitions are being fraudulently signed by people from all over the world on UK petitions, in particular in reference to the request for another referendum.

Anyone signing a petition MUST be legally eligible to do so, and the current system is being abused extensively and illegally. Having a formal system in place would not only prevent fraud, but where fraud does occur would offer the opportunity to take legal action against those concerned and maintain democracy.

attributes.action: Trans issues should be taught as part of Personal, Social and Health Education
attributes.background: Trans issues should be taught as part of Personal, Social and Health Education. Also, Gender-variant young people should get sufficient support at school. Schools need to understand their responsibilities under the Equality Act 2010 and must ensure all staff receive training.
attributes.additional_details: The House of Commons Women and Equalities Committee published a report in January 2016 with regards to Transgender Equality. Within this report it was established that more needs to be done to ensure that gender-variant young people receive support in school. the Equality and Human Rights Commission stated that research shows that 91% of trans boys and 66% of trans girls experience harassment or bullying at school, leading to depression, isolation and the desire to leave education.

attributes.action: Increase public spending by £350 million per week as the Leave campaign promised
attributes.background: Government to increase direct spending on public services by £350,000,000 per week in real terms by the end of 2018, without increasing taxes, as the Brexit Leave campaign promised.

attributes.action: Guarantee a minimum extra £100m per week invested into the NHS.
attributes.background:
'Vote Leave' have successfully won the EU Referendum and we can expect the UK to start proceedings to withdraw from Europe. 

'Vote Leave' campaigned with assurances that the money we are currently handing over to the EU could be better spent on our own public services.
attributes.additional_details:
Now that 'Leave' have won this referendum they need to live up to the promises made during the campaign and guarantee that this money will be spent on public services that greatly need extra support. 

"Let's give our NHS the £350 million the EU takes every week" was a specific slogan of the 'Leave' campaign. The 'Leave' campaign website also stated "Vote Leave to invest an extra £100m into the NHS every week".

These were explicit statements made during the campaign and many people have voted on the back of such promises made. The government needs to ensure that any negotiations out of the EU also includes assurances that funds currently paid to the EU be reinvested into our public services and specifically into our underfunded NHS.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on independence for London
attributes.background: Unlike the rest of the UK, London is predominantly Labour and the whole of London voted to remain in the EU. We are no longer philosophically in step with the rest of the UK. We suggest that London be afforded the opportunity to declare independence, or become part of Scotland, in a referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
London: housing crisis, Muslim Labour mayor, diverse and younger population, voted remain unanimously
Rest of UK: predominantly Conservative, voted for leaving the EU, affordable housing still exists

attributes.action: Petition for London and the South East to breakaway from the UK
attributes.background: After the Brexit vote, London clearly has a different stance on the future to the rest of the country. London also has a vastly different economy to the rest of the country so breaking away makes sesne
attributes.additional_details:
Regional Brexit vote split

http://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/2016-brexit-referendum/

attributes.action: Make it an illegal offence for women to smoke/drink/use drugs whilst pregnant.
attributes.background: People know the risks of tobacco, alcohol and drugs, we all know the risks and dangers we're exposed to, we wouldn't dream of giving these to children, never mind newborn babies. So why do so many women continue to use these whilst pregnant? They are knowingly harming their unborn child.
attributes.additional_details:
Just like smoking and drinking, drugs have a major effect on a baby, the least of which is giving birth to a baby who is addicted to the drug. The consequences of using cocaine, for example, include heart attack, respiratory failure, strokes, and seizures, and all these life-threatening health problems can also be passed to an unborn baby.

All these products increase the risk of miscarriage, low birth weight, health complications and risks later in life, including mental health problems.

attributes.action: Boycott the 2018 World Cup in Russia
attributes.background:
After the violence and racism by Russian supporters in the Euro 2016 football tournament in France. 
I would like the Government Ministers to boycott anything to do with the 2018 World Cup in Russia.
attributes.additional_details: If our government can do this. It will show they are looking out for the safety of the British Citizens which would be at risk if they were to fly out there. And with Government support, the British people, FA, World Cup sponsors and other qualifying countries may consider boycotting the tournament as well. Our Gouvernment needs to show it will not support at tournament that was won on bribes and cannot promise the safety of the British public.

attributes.action: Teach Current Affairs in schools and promote learning about the world
attributes.background: It is vital that the people we depend on to be our future have unbiased access to what is going on in this world. Citizenship focuses on 'British values'... We can teach kids to grow up thinking for themselves
attributes.additional_details:
The Citizenship foundation's website explains that citizenship is taught in schools as an 'ideal tool for exploring British values.'
However we should be exploring world values, world affairs that are happening right now. 
History is very important but how can we depend on the 'generation of the future' to build a better world if they are not learning about the world now.
We need to promote decision making based on free and open thinking

http://www.citizenshipfoundation.org.uk/main/page.php?286

attributes.action: Make FREE  temporary housing provisions for the homeless and support accessible
attributes.background: I want the government to make FREE temporary housing provisions available and accessible throughout the UK and give our homeless support to find permanent housing, lifestyles support such as counselling so they can regain a functioning position within society again
attributes.additional_details: More and More homeless are appearing on the streets of the UK, some have lost everything and have nowhere to turn so do the best they can by sleeping on the streets and begging , some are war veterans who have fought then been cast to one side as they as if a person is expendable, so turn to drugs and alcohol to fade out the pain. Homelessness is not normal and these people need support and not to be cast aside, ignored, left to freeze to death on the street or forced into crime to survive.

attributes.action: Make it UK law to label all consumer products as vegan/vegetarian/non-vegetarian
attributes.background: There has been numerous times when I have discovered (by contacting companies) a product is vegetarian, yet it is not disclosed on the packaging. Stating items as vegan/vegetarian or not should become a legal requirement as it would make it easier to purchase according to each individual lifestyle.
attributes.additional_details: This law should apply to ALL consumer products sold in the UK from food and drink to cosmetics and everyday essentials, such as toothpaste and hand wash.

attributes.action: Establish an independent department to ensure truthful politics
attributes.background: In a year where the Oxford English Dictionary names its Word of the Year as 'post-truth', then something has gone wrong in the politics & campaigning world. This is a petition asking for the establishing of an independent department that will ensure truthful politics.
attributes.additional_details: We had the infamous claim that if we leave the EU, instead of sending £350 million a week to them, we can send it to the NHS; and then after the result declaring that we didn't actually send the EU that much money, & also it wouldn't be going directly to the NHS. This new independent department should consist of teams from Ofcom,Advertising Agency,CPS,ONS and electoral lawyers (etc) to ensure that no politician can mislead the public with unsubstantiated claims and that UK politics are truthful.

attributes.action: Negotiate safe removal of children and pregnant women from Syrian cities
attributes.background: The situation in Syria, particularly in Eastern Aleppo and other areas under siege, continues to deteriorate beyond what is livable. Attempts at peace have failed. We believe that the United Kingdom must lead the way in providing the safe removal of children and pregnant women from these areas.
attributes.additional_details:
Eastern Aleppo's children's hospital has been bombed. Sick children and babies have no place to receive basic care. Other basic resources, such as food, are running out.

The UK understands the importance of removing women and children from cities being bombed, as this was practised during WWII. The situation is even more dire in Syria. We cannot stand by and do nothing. The UK must lead. We mus act now to save these children.

attributes.action: To build a new Northern bypass around Ipswich
attributes.background: The Orwell Bridge has been closed in Ipswich all morning due to high winds, causing traffic chaos and gridlock in the town, it's about time a Northern bypass around Ipswich was built to defer the traffic from the town when the bridge is closed.
attributes.additional_details: It's 2016 and it's ridiculous that such a large town is so reliant on the bridge being open, as soon as there's an accident or bad weather, it's closed and the traffic has nowhere to go but through the town, which the infrastructure just cannot cope, costing businesses millions of pounds in lost revenue, especially haulage companies as they're reliant on the a14 to and from the port of felixstowe, get this Northern bypass built.

attributes.action: Fully and transparently explore the Hyperloop concept to deliver HS1 and HS2.
attributes.background:
The proposed HS1 and HS2 investments should deliver infrastructure for the future - but they are currently on-target to deploy a concept that hasn't improved since the Victorian era.

The Hyperloop is different. It offers the potential for high speeds and sustainability. We should evaluate it.
attributes.additional_details:
Full details of the design and rationale can be found here:

https://www.tesla.com/en_GB/blog/hyperloop

attributes.action: Ban FRACKING in the UK!!
attributes.background:
Fracking leads to devastating consequences for the environment. 
It contaminates groundwater with the use of toxic chemicals, contaminates the land, can cause earthquakes!
attributes.additional_details: Science!!!

attributes.action: Change the Postal Voting System
attributes.background:
The postal voting system is wide open to abuse
There have been numerous examples of postal voter fraud in our country.
We believe that postal votes should only be available to our Armed Forces, people who are ill or who are on holiday
Also make photo ID at polling stations mandatory

attributes.action: Make England have BST during winter and  BST + 1 hour during the summer.
attributes.background:
The advantages include:
-increased daylight during the afternoon.
-energy saving from lighting being delayed, producing reduced carbon emissions;
-reduced roads accidents
-health benefit from afternoon sunlight and outdoor exercise
- benefit the tourist trade
- no cost to UK exchequer
attributes.additional_details: The Royal Society for the Prevention of accidents is in favour of GMT + 1 hour in the winter and GMT + 2 hours in the summer as more people are killed on the road as a result of the earlier afternoon darkness in the winter caused by our current winter time of GMT.

attributes.action: Protect Whistleblowers in care sectors who are dismissed after whistle blowing
attributes.background: How many people working in any care sector have had to blow the whistle to find shortly after the procedure,they lose their job?I ask to protect whistleblowers after whistleblowing procedure.Future disciplinary hearings(or the like)to be held by different members of staff than the original procedure
attributes.additional_details: Whistleblowers need more protection than they get currently in the care sector. Too many people who choose to stand for the right thing and fight, lose their jobs in the end-these righteous people are the people we need working as doctors, nurses, support workers etc. There must be a change.

attributes.action: Legislate against premature marketing of festivals, especially Christmas
attributes.background: The excitement of Christmas is spoiled by premature marketing in shops, 'papers and TV. We are not killjoys, but tinselled TV ads and festive trees in Malls in early November dwindles our joy well before the event. We propose, under penalty, the first day of marketing for Christmas as 1st of Dec.
attributes.additional_details: Other festivals can be included in legislation (e.g. 1 week prior to Valentines, Easter, Halloween) but the law must first target Christmas. We accept there are commercial ventures that that may be exempt since they rely on festivals such as Christmas for much of their business and therefore need to market early, e.g. Christmas hamper savings, turkey butchers, greeting card shops, booking for a Christmas party, etc. Punishments for breaking the law should raise money for children's charities.

attributes.action: Ban drinking alcohol in Parliament by MP's
attributes.background: Alcohol at work is not allowed as it is unsafe and people can make decisions that when they were sober they may consider what they did was inappropriate.  So why when the interest of the UK is being debated and voted on by MP's are they allowed to be under the influence of alcohol.
